programme.title: A DIOS MOMO
programme.desc: Little Obdulio sells newspapers on the street to bring home a few coins for his family. His life is altered when he befriends the night watchman of the newspaper, a magical "Maestro," who will not only introduce him to reading, but also teach him the real meaning of life, using the lyrics of the "Murgas" under the spell of the God MoMo during the mythical nights of the Uruguayan Carnival.

programme.title: MATERNALLY YOURS Episode 1
programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.title: MATERNALLY YOURS Episode 2
programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.title: HAIR THAT MOVES
programme.desc: Upon entering a singing competition to pay for her travels to school, a 10-year old girl tries all she can to get her short, afro to wave in the wind like her favorite pop star's hair.

programme.title: Pahokee - Skip Day
programme.desc: Three award-winning short films that exquisitely capture the Pahokee community, a small black Florida town.

programme.title: The Thorn of the Rose
programme.desc: Prosecuting Attorney David Lunga's success is overshadowed by the terrifying secrets of Rosa, a beautiful but mysterious woman with whom he falls in love. What mysteries does she hide? As the macabre facts unravel, David comes face to face with his own demons and is driven to prove his innocence, recover his reputation and, above all, clear his own conscience.

programme.title: Discovering ABJ Episode 1
programme.desc: Discovering ABJ is a coming of age story that reflects the diversity of a new generation of Nigerians seeking to express and define themselves in a changing world.

programme.title: WAVES S1 EP1
programme.desc: Nia and her sister Jean have an estranged relationship after Jean becomes close with alcohol and partying, around the same time Nia was going through a break up with her fiancĂ©. Jean now returns a year later hoping to mend the relationship with her sister. However, she has a secret that will rip their relationship apart for good.

programme.desc: Nia and her sister Jean have an estranged relationship after Jean becomes close with alcohol and partying, around the same time Nia was going through a break up with her fiancĂ©. programme.title: TITLE VII
programme.desc: The CEO of Sanger International, an IT consulting firm, is powerful and successful Hillary Kelsey. Kelsey is a black woman with no black employees and no one can figure out whyâ€”until Darryl Montgomery, her 9:30 am interview, enters the firm.

programme.title: CLOSE TO THE LINE
programme.desc: The true story of a spiritual journey. Singer/songwriter Chris Van Loan Sr.'s life is changed forever because of the events that occur in one evening amongst some of Austin's most eclectic musicians and poets. Featuring cameo appearances by Kevin Gant and Thom the World Poet.

programme.title: THE LONG ROAD TO HALL OF FAME
programme.desc: The Long Road To The Hall Of Fame is a feature length documentary about Malik Farrakhan, his life is a parable spanning the last 40 years of African-American history.

programme.title: AFROPOLITAINE EP 1
programme.desc: Afropolitaine is a web-series focused on the Afro-French culture. Afropolitaine tells the story of two Paris-based millennials sisters and their family dynamics.

programme.title: AFROPOLITAINE EP 2
programme.desc: Afropolitaine is a web-series focused on the Afro-French culture. Afropolitaine tells the story of two Paris-based millennials sisters and their family dynamics.

programme.title: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump At The Sun
programme.desc: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump at the Sun is a moving interpretation of Zora Neale Hurston's life and career.

programme.title: La Source
programme.desc: Narrated by Oscar-nominated actor Don Cheadle (Hotel Rwanda, Crash), La Source tells the uplifting story of Josue Lajuenesse, a Haitian Princeton janitor who returns to his country after the devastating 2010 earthquake to revive his lifelong dream to bring what is most fundamental to his village's survival; clean water.

programme.title: DREAMTOWN
programme.desc: DreamTown is a documentary about the precarious dream of a young Afro-Ecuadorian soccer player, Anibal Chala, as he strives to make it to the professional leagues, and eventually sees his dreams become reality.

programme.title: Wilmington on Fire
programme.desc: On November 10, an armed mob of white supremacists opened fire on African American neighborhoods, slaughtering hundreds and driving thousands out of the city for good.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: A couple, Nessa and Camden, continue their tradition of looking through each others phones once a month, but questionable text messages reveal the truth.

programme.title: CLOSURE
programme.desc: Angela, an African-American raised by a Caucasian couple in a large, multiracial family in Washington State, comes face to face with her birth mother for the first time, and meets family members who had never known she was even born â€“ including her birth father.
